extracted_text:
On August 25, 2025, Maruti Suzuki India Limited (MSIL) began the series production of its first battery electric vehicle (BEV), the e-Vitara, at its plant in Hansalpur, Gujarat . This was a substantial corporate development with several significant facets:

Production and export plans: The made-in-India e-Vitara will be sold domestically and exported to over 100 countries, including European nations and Japan. The company aims to become India's largest electric carmaker in its first year in the EV market.

Expansion of EV ecosystem: To support the new EV, a new assembly line was commissioned with an investment of ₹2,000 crore. Additionally, a new lithium-ion battery plant in Hansalpur—a joint venture with Toshiba and Denso—began local production of hybrid battery electrodes, supporting the company's hybrid and EV plans.

Strategic investment: Parent company Suzuki Motor Corporation announced plans to invest ₹70,000 crore in India over the next five to six years to strengthen its advanced automotive and green mobility manufacturing.

Government involvement: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi attended the event to flag off the first e-Vitara, endorsing the project as a major step for the "Make in India" initiative and the country's green mobility goals.
